course_description: An advanced exploration of key texts and issues in phenomenology. Typical figures include Husserl, Heidegger, Merleau-Ponty, and Edith Stein. Possible issues include the nature of consciousness, human embodiment, affect and empathy, the imagination, and temporality. Philosophy course.
prerequisites: Two PHIL courses or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 5480, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: Blanes-Martinez/Estrada, Status: Wait List
